page.title: 08THE QUEEN'S HEAD,NR.COVENTRY
page.content: The Queens head pub in Bretford dates back to 1839. {* * * * * * * * * * * * * There are tables and benches outside for you to sit on in the summer. Inside there are three rooms open to the public:- A bar, a lounge, and a restaurant. There are eighteen part time staff working in the pub. They work behind the bar, in the restaurant and in the kitchens.The chef has had catering training.The owner went to Henley College for catering training. They have all sorts of drinks which they serve in the pub to the public. There are three draft beers. These are natural beers that are stored in metal casks in the cellar. There are three keg beers that are stored under gas pressure, in metal casks in the cellar Opening times-10.30-14.30&18.30-23.30
